headline: Assessing the Season as It Crosses Center Ice
abstract: At the halfway mark of the season, five head coaches have been fired, and the St. Louis Blues are thriving as the reigning champions.
lead_paragraph: As December came to a close, the N.H.L. season hit its midpoint. For some teams, things reached a breaking point: Three more head coaches were fired in the past month. For others, December was a high point: The Pittsburgh Penguins, the Toronto Maple Leafs and the Tampa Bay Lightning were among the teams who had their best month of the season. Consistently productive performers and breakout talents alike shined as the calendar year came to an end, and the sport’s future was on display at the International Ice Hockey Federation’s world junior championships.
